columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the stock price based in the industry average required return.

The required rate of return of a company refers to the minimum amount, in terms of percentage, that the investor expects from their investment. Companies often use different bases in order to solve for the required rate of return.

The industry average rate of return, as the name suggests, is the rate of return that a group of companies that provide the same services have. This is a good estimate that companies can use to value their stock and pit it against their competitors.

For this problem, we will use the industry average rate of return to solve for the stock price of the company. Before we do this, we need to provide the given values that will be essential in the solution.


| Earnings per share| $3.15| 
|--|--| 
| Dividend| $45,000| 
| Number of shares| 50,000| 
| Return on retentions|17% | 
|Cost of equity|14%
| Industry average rate of return|11.67% |
